import Mathlib

/-- If A : R^n â†’ R^m is a linear map, then A has a (FrÃ©chet) derivative at every point and that
    derivative equals A itself (as a continuous linear map). -/
variable {n m : â„•}

theorem linear_map.has_fderiv_at_real (A : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’â‚—[â„] (Fin m â†’ â„)) (x : Fin n â†’ â„) :
  HasFderivAt (A : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ (Fin m â†’ â„)) (A.toContinuousLinearMap) x := by sorry

theorem linear_map.fderiv_eq_self (A : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’â‚—[â„] (Fin m â†’ â„)) (x : Fin n â†’ â„) :
  fderiv â„ (A : (Fin n â†’ â„) â†’ (Fin m â†’ â„)) x = A.toContinuousLinearMap := by sorry
